message.content: This question requires an understanding of the physics of sound. When a rod is wobbling from being struck with a stick, it will create vibrations in the air, which will produce sound waves. These sound waves will be audible to our ears, so option (C) is the correct answer. Option (A) is unrelated to the physics of the situation. Option (B) is incorrect because the wobbling rod will create sound. Option (D) is unrelated to the physics of sound and freezing.

Option (D) is not related to the behavior of the rod when struck.
